lexUnit.name: atop.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: in contact with the upper part of and supported by.

sentence.text: Rather than converting Windows applications for Unix in the current fashion , nQue is doing a version for Unix that will run atop Windows .

But atop the blue tower blocks of big Waimea , he attracted as much attention as the Pope on the balcony of St Peter 's .
Once again there were a hat and feathers atop the lid .
The weather-vane is perched atop the Great Tower , some 34 yards above ground level .

We climbed into the back , already full of people perched atop a deep pile of cargo , and squeezed into a rear corner , hoping there was no one else to come .

Lastly , and indisputably , we are sitting atop the equivalent of roughly 200 million tons of TNT .

The camera left the vista of rumbling tanks and panned across the row of faces atop Lenin 's Mausoleum .
Reinforcements fortunate enough to arrive got lost in the chaos atop the ridge , wandering all night to find their new positions .
A rocket atop the Warlord tracked tentatively towards the shuddering Emperor .
A series of increasingly disconnected twists leads , via murder , the courtroom and the madhouse , to a pseudo-Hitchcockian climax atop a storm-lashed lighthouse .

Lustful travellers came from all over the world to watch him dance , naked except for a silk cap atop his curls .

Suddenly , he grinned , and clambered up atop the altar stone .
